intro: Crotalaria nagarjunakondensis, commonly known as Nagarjunakonda Crotalaria, is a flowering plant native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which is characterized by its leguminous properties and nitrogen-fixing capabilities. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in dry and semi-arid environments. It features compound leaves and produces yellow or orange flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its limited distribution and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
